Module me.t8d.c482.c482
Package me.t8d.c482.c482.controller

Class AddProductFormController

java.lang.Object
me.t8d.capstone.frontend.controller.AddProductFormController
public class AddProductFormController extends Object
UI/UX for the user to create and add a new product. The user fills in all fields, optionally adding associated parts, and if all is valid, creates the product, adding it into the applications Inventory. RUNTIME ERROR: Resizing window was left enabled.. while the GridPanes behaved right, the bottom Pane for the save/cancel buttons did not move with the resize, leaving it possible to hide the buttons. It was also possible to resize the window smaller to have the form cover up the form label to the left, and smaller yet to make the radio button labels unreadable. The simplest fix is just to disable window resizing.
Author:
Thomas Miller

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(MainFormController mainFormControllerRef, Inventory inv, int newProductId)
      Initialize the controller by setting up the tables (prefilling the unassociated parts to the inventory's parts), and all the textProperties for all forms.
      Parameters:
      mainFormControllerRef - as the reference to the running MainFormController
      inv - as the reference to the MainController's inventory.
      newProductId - as the ID to assign to the new product.

    • deleteBtnOnClick

      public void deleteBtnOnClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Takes the currently selected part from the associated part table, and adds it into the unassociated part table (removing from associated parts) -- This prompts for user confirmation before continuing. RUNTIME ERROR: It previously allowed working with empty items (example: if the productAssociatedTable was empty)
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - is unused, but passed by the FXML Button as an onClick argument.

    • lookupPart

      public Part lookupPart(int partId, javafx.collections.ObservableList<Part> lookupList)
      Note: this exists as a copy from the inventory function, but since this isn't using an Inventory for it's temporary tables, this is needed.
      Parameters:
      partId - the ID of the desired part to find within the inventory
      Returns:
      The desired part
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - if no part by the provided ID is found
